intro: Scelochilus campoverdei, commonly known as the Campoverde's scelochilus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring elongated, showy petals and a specialized lip that aids in pollination. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas with rich, well-drained soil. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
